column2: Dutch: Gogh) is a town in the district of Kleve
column4: Germany. It is situated close to the border with the Siebengewald in Netherlands
column5: approx. 12 km (7 mi) south of Kleve
column6: and 27 km (17 mi) southeast of Nijmegen.

column1: Goch is at least 750 years old: the earliest mention of Goch is in a document dated 1259. It was a part of the Duchy of Cleves. During World War II
column2: the city was completely destroyed by Allied bombers during Operation Veritable.
